issues.description: The reference solution declares the toString() method with the wrong return type (public Object toString()). The problem statement asks for a custom toString() (example shows a String) and in Java the toString() method must return a String to correctly override Object.toString(). Declaring toString() to return Object (and annotating it with @Override) will cause a compilation error in the solution and conflicts with the expected method signature students will implement (public String toString()). This is an unintentional structural mismatch that will confuse students and make the provided solution uncompilable.
issues.suggested_fix: Change the toString() method in the solution to return String to match Java's Object.toString() and the exercise expectation. For example: replace 'public Object toString()' with 'public String toString()' (keep the @Override annotation). Ensure the method returns a String (as already constructed) so the solution compiles and matches the problem description.
